title: Toyota To Make Mostly Electric, Alt-Fuel Cars By 2050 TM TSLA - Investors.com
text:
T oyota Motor (NYSE: TM ) is racing to become the first global automaker to transition from being a maker of mostly gasoline-engine vehicles to one that primarily makes electric vehicles (EVs) and other nonconventional-fuel cars. 
The company, which vies with Volkswagen (OTCPK: VLKAY ) as top global automaker by sales, on Wednesday laid out a plan under which a majority of its sales will be EVs, fuel cell-powered cars and other alternative vehicles by 2050. 
"It wouldn't be easy for gasoline and diesel cars to survive" in the long term, said Toyota Senior Managing Officer Kiyotaka Ise at a media briefing in Japan .   View Enlarged Image 

He added, "With such massive decline in engine-powered cars, it's like the world is turning upside down, and Toyota has to change its ways." Gasoline or diesel still powers about 85% of Toyota's cars. 
Toyota tweeted that it plans to sell 30,000 fuel cell vehicles and 7 million hybrids by 2020. 
Toyota is seeing increasing competition, including high-end EVs from Tesla Motors (NASDAQ: TSLA ). Tesla plans to launch the mass-market Model 3, priced at $35,000, within two years. 
General Motors (NYSE: GM ) is also developing a mass-market EV, the Bolt, and already sells the mid-priced plug-in hybrid Volt. Nissan Motor 's (OTCPK: NSANY ) Leaf hybrid has also gained adherents. 
But Ise said that Toyota isn't quitting on gas and diesel engines completely. Some areas — for example, in remote regions — will still rely on those fuels because of the difficulty of building EV charging stations. 
Toyota closed down 0.8% on the stock market today . General Motors was up 0.6%, and Tesla fell 1%. Volkswagen was unchanged and Nissan ended down 2%.
